page.title: 14SANDY BEACHES IN EDAY
page.content: Doomy and Mussetter are two of the many beaches on Eday. They almost all one beach with a band of rocks separating them. People go to the beaches to lie on the sand on hot days or paddle or swim in the sea. Also people come in buggies or motor bikes to have some fun on the sand. When there is a strong wind driftwood, rubbish, seaweed and steel buoys are left on the sand by the tide. Sometimes the tide comes right up and fills the loch on the far side of the dunes. At very low tides spoots can be caught here. They are then taken home, cleaned, cooked and eaten. Spoot is the Orkney word for razor fish.
